content.text:
# Houston Film Critics Society Awards 2023

| location  = [https://matchouston.org Midtown Arts & Theater Center Houston], Texas
| website   =
| previous  = 2022
| main      = HFCSA
| next      = 2024
}}
The 17th Houston Film Critics Society Awards were announced on January 22, 2024, at the Midtown Arts & Theater Center Houston (MATCH) in Texas. The nominations were announced on January 9, 2024, with Barbie leading the nominations with ten, followed by Oppenheimer with nine.
The nominees for the Texas Independent Film Award were announced on December 6, 2023.
Winners and nominees
, Best Director winner]]
, Best Actor winner]]
, Best Actress winner]]
, Best Supporting Actor winner]]
, Best Supporting Actress winner]]
, Best Original Score winner]]
Winners are listed first and highlighted with boldface.
{| class="wikitable"
! style="background:#EEDD82; width:50%"| Best Picture
! style="background:#EEDD82; width:50%"| Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
* Poor Things
** American Fiction
** ''Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret.
** Barbie
** The Color Purple
** Godzilla Minus One
** The Holdovers
** Killers of the Flower Moon
** Oppenheimer
** Past Lives
| valign="top" |
* 'Christopher Nolan – Oppenheimer'
** Greta Gerwig – Barbie
** Yorgos Lanthimos – Poor Things
** Alexander Payne – The Holdovers
** Martin Scorsese – Killers of the Flower Moon
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width:50%"| Best Actor
! style="background:#EEDD82; width:50%"| Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Paul Giamatti – The Holdovers as Paul Hunham'
** Leonardo DiCaprio – Killers of the Flower Moon as Ernest Burkhart
** Cillian Murphy – Oppenheimer as J. Robert Oppenheimer
** Andrew Scott – All of Us Strangers as Adam
** Jeffrey Wright – American Fiction as Thelonious "Monk" Ellison
| valign="top" |
* 'Emma Stone – Poor Things as Bella Baxter'
** Fantasia Barrino – The Color Purple as Celie Harris-Johnson
** Lily Gladstone – Killers of the Flower Moon as Mollie Burkhart
** Greta Lee – Past Lives as Nora Moon
** Margot Robbie – Barbie as Barbie
|-

! style="background:#EEDD82; width:50%"| Best Supporting Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Ryan Gosling – Barbie as Ken'
** Robert De Niro – Killers of the Flower Moon as William King Hale
** Robert Downey Jr. – Oppenheimer as Lewis Strauss
** Mark Ruffalo – Poor Things as Duncan Wedderburn
** Dominic Sessa – The Holdovers as Angus Tully
| valign="top" |
* 'Da'Vine Joy Randolph – The Holdovers as Mary Lamb'
** Emily Blunt – Oppenheimer as Kitty Oppenheimer
** Danielle Brooks – The Color Purple as Sofia
** Rachel McAdams – Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret. as Barbara Simon
** Rosamund Pike – Saltburn as Lady Elspeth Catton
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width:50%"| Best Screenplay

** David Hemingson – The Holdovers

* Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
** The Boy and the Heron

** Robot Dreams
** Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem

** 20 Days in Mariupol

* '"I'm Just Ken" – Barbie'
** "Dance the Night" – Barbie''
** "Keep It Movin'" – The Color Purple
** "Meet in the Middle" – Flora and Son
** "What Was I Made For?" – Barbie

| style="vertical-align:top;" colspan="2"|
* '[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9201172/ Chocolate Lizards]'': Mark Lambert Bristol imagines a failed actor's next steps in Buffalo Gap'
** [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt12915204/ Bolivar]'': Nell Teare explores a young woman's journey to recover from her mother's death
** [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt27421496/ Breaking the Code]: Michael Flanagan revisits the work and life of artist Vernon Fisher of Fort Worth
** ''[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt21970786/ I'll Be There]: Andrew Shea considers how people search for connection in the midst of chaos
** [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt29009803/ A Town Called Victoria]'': Li Liu examines how people confront how they learn to hate
|}
